contentrichtext.text: {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2012}} {{Infobox Officeholder |name = Ruben Kun |image = |imagesize = |smallimage = |caption = |order = [[President of Nauru]] |term_start = 19 December 1996 |term_end = 13 February 1997 |predecessor = [[Kennan Adeang]] |successor = [[Kinza Clodumar]] |birth_date = |birth_place = |death_date = |death_place = |constituency = |party = |spouse = |children = |profession = [[Lawyer]] |religion = |signature = |footnotes = }} {{Infobox MP |honorific-prefix =[[The Honourable]] |name = Ruben Kun |honorific-suffix =[[Member of Parliament#Nauru|MP]] |image = |constituency_MP = [[Buada District|Buada]] |parliament = Nauruan |majority = |predecessor = |successor = |term_start = |term_end = |office1 = |predecessor1 = [[Totouwa Depaune]]{{Citation needed|date=February 2009}} |successor1 = [[Tamaiti Star]] |term_start1 = 25 January 1971{{Citation needed|date=February 2009}} |term_end1 = 16 November 1992 |office2 = |predecessor2 = [[Tamaiti Star]] |successor2 = [[Terangi Adam]] |term_start2 = 20 November 1995 |term_end2 = 8 April 2000 |birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1942|03|30|df=y}}<ref>{{cite book | url=http://books.google.ca/books?id=MAExAQAAIAAJ&q=Ruben+Kun+1942&dq=Ruben+Kun+1942&hl=en&sa=X&ei=L_MMT871AqTTiAKj3OXhDg&ved=0CF0Q6AEwCQ | title=Journal de la Société des océanistes | page=322}} Issues 50-53.</ref> |birth_place = [[Nauru]] |death_date = |death_place = |nationality = {{flagicon|Nauru}} [[Nauru]]an |spouse = |party = |relations = |children = |residence = |alma_mater = |occupation = |profession = |religion = [[Christian]] |signature = |website = |footnotes = }} HE '''Ruben James Kun''' (born 30 March 1942) is a political figure from the [[Pacific]] nation of [[Nauru]] and was [[President of Nauru|President]] of the Republic of [[Nauru]]. ==Early career== Ruben Kun is a lawyer by training. He has been Speaker of the [[Nauruan Parliament]].<ref>Europa World Year book 1985</ref> Kun served as finance minister, prior to assuming Presidential office. ==President of Nauru== Kun succeeded [[Kennan Adeang]] as [[President of Nauru]] from 19 December 1996 to 13 February 1997, and was himself succeeded in that office by [[Kinza Clodumar]]. ==Post-Presidency== Under the [[Pacific Solution]] asylum policy, [[Australia]] has an arrangement with Nauru that allows asylum seekers arriving in Australia to be detained on the island. Kun is now representing detainees in a case before the nation's Supreme Court. ==See also== * [[Politics of Nauru]] ==References== {{reflist}} {{NauruPres}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Kun, Ruben | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = President of Nauru | DATE OF BIRTH = 30 March 1942 | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Kun, Ruben}} [[Category:Members of the Parliament of Nauru]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Presidents of Nauru]] [[Category:People from Buada District]] [[Category:1942 births]] [[Category:Government ministers of Nauru]] {{Nauru-politician-stub}}
